intro: Doliocarpus verruculosus, commonly known as the rough-leafed doliocarpus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Anacardiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland areas. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, clustered yellowish-green flowers. Its fruit is a fleshy, spiny capsule that contains several seeds. This species is often found in secondary forests and is adapted to thrive in warm, moist environments.
